div.p: The official URL for this implementation guide is:

description.value: This section contains the main top level resources that are used in a Breast Radiology Report.
This section contains resources that are commonly used throughout a Breast Radiology Report
This section contains value sets that are commonly used throughout a Breast Radiology Report
This section contains code systems that are commonly used throughout a Breast Radiology Report
This section contains resources used specifically in a Mammography exam
This section contains value sets used specifically in a Mammography exam
This section contains code systems used specifically in a Mammography exam
This section contains resources used specifically in a MRI exam
This section contains value sets used specifically in a MRI exam
This section contains code systems used specifically in a MRI exam
This section contains resources used specifically in a Ultra-Sound exam
This section contains value sets used specifically in a Ultra-Sound exam
This section contains code systems used specifically in a Ultra-Sound exam
This section contains resources used specifically in a Nuclear Medicine exam
This section contains value sets used specifically in a Nuclear Medicine exam
This section contains code systems used specifically in a Nuclear Medicine exam
This section contains resources used specifically by AIM
This section contains value sets used specifically by AIM
This section contains code systems used specifically by AIM
This section the fragments that are used to define the resources

The following artifacts define the specific capabilities that different types of systems are expected to have in order to comply with this implementation guide. Systems complying with the implementation guide are expected to declare conformance to one or more of the following capability statements.
These are custom operations that can be supported by and/or invoked by systems complying with this implementation guide
These define the types of messages that can be sent and/or received by systems complying with this implementation guide
These define collections of interrelated resources that are useful to pass around as a group
These define data models that represent the domain covered by this implementation guide in more business-friendly terms than the underlying FHIR resources.
These define forms used by systems conforming with this implementation guide to capture or expose data to end users

These are profiles on resources or data types that describe patterns used by other profiles, but can't be instantiated directly. I.e. instances can conform to profiles *based* on these abstract profiles, but don't declare conformance to the abstract profiles themselves.
These define constraints on FHIR resources that need to be complied with by conformant implementations
These define constraints on FHIR data types that need to be complied with by conformant implementations
These define constraints on FHIR data types that need to be complied with by conformant implementations
These define sets of codes used by systems conforming with this implementation guide
These define new code systems used by systems conforming with this implementation guide
These define identifier and/or code system identities used by systems conforming with this implementation guide
These define transformations to convert between data structures used by systems conforming with this implementation guide
These define transformations to convert between codes by systems conforming with this implementation guide
These define groups of interrelated examples that demonstrate one or more of the workflows supported by this implementation guide
These are example instances that show what data produced and consumed by systems conforming with this implementation guide might look like
These are resources that are used within this implementation guide that don't fit into one of the other categories
Lymph node abnormality types code system.
Breast body location angles (expressed in clock-face units) code system.

Observed Feature seen during a breast examination.

lymph node abnormality types value set.
Breast body location angles (expressed in clock-face units) value set.
Breast body location depth value set.

Breast body location region value set.
Calcification Distribution of an abnormality value set.
Foreign objects observed during a Breast Radiology exam value set

Mammography density abnormality refinement value set.
Observed changes in an abnormality value set.
Observed feature observed during a Breast Radiology exam value set
Fragment 'Fragment that adds 'BiRad code' element to profile.'
Fragment 'Fragment definition for finding section of left or right breast'
Fragment 'Not Previously Seen component slice fragment'
Fragment 'Fragment that adds 'Observed Changes' element to profile.'
Fragment 'Fragment that adds 'Observed Count' element to profile.'
Fragment 'Fragment that adds 'Observed Distribution' components to Observation.'
Fragment 'Fragment that adds 'Observed Size' components to Observation.'
Observed Distribution in an abnormality code system.

Observation of a size or size range in 1, 2, or 3 dimensions. Observation of a one or more items and the size and grouping of the item(s) The size can be one, two, or three dimensional. The axes can be oriented to certain landmarks, or ordered by size. Each dimention can be a quantity (i.e. 5 cm), or a range (1 cm to 5 cm). If the lower bound of the range is set but not the upper bound, then it means {lower bound} cm or more. If the upper bound of the range is set but not the lower bound, then it means {upper bound} cm or less.
Item Group Component Codes value set.
Observed Distribution of an abnormality value set.
